divs: sighting detailsi live on a hill overlooking lake norfolk in arkansas, the rear of my home faces south toward the lake norfolk dam. it was a cloudy, cold afternoon about 3:00 pm. i happened to be standing at my rear window looking out over the lake when from my left a brilliant crystal white ball of light raced south over lake norfolk toward the dam about 200 feet over the water.. it was lower than i was so i was looking a bit downward at it. it appeared to be about the size of a small bus or van, it was a brilliant crystal white. there is a row of trees that was between the object and me but there are no leaves at this time of year so i got a great look at it. it appeared to be rolling with flashing strobe lights, however it was passing behind the trees and i am not sure if it was actually flashing or the flashing was caused by the object passing behind the trees. as the object got south of me it slowed almost to a stop did a couple zigs and appeared to split into two or three small objects. it then continued slowly toward the dam and then disappeared. i never saw it rise above the tree line\horizon. the sighting did not last more than about 15 seconds.i had no other feelings than wow what was that. a few weeks later i saw a program on tv showing the stephenville lights and i realized that they were about the same thing that i saw.
trends: There have been 6 other sightings in Mountain Home
There were no other sightings in Mountain Home on or around February 27th 2013
